monster.name: Aspect of Glutony

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
trait.text: The gluttony has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The gluttony can use its action to polymorph in the last thing that it fed upon of Huge size or smaller, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size and special move, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: When the gluttony assumes the form of a creature it has devoured, it becomes indistinguishable from a normal specimen of that creature's species. Only a spell such as trueseeing or similar spell of 6th level or higher can reveal the Gluttony's true form.

trait.name: Unwieldy
trait.text: Other creatures must use 15 feet of speed to try to move the Gluttony 5 feet.

action.name: Ravenous Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage. The gluttony regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with an insatiable hunger. Each curse bestows a level of exhaustion, and multiple curses accumulate. The exhaustion persists until the cursed creature consumes food during a short or long rest, is targeted by a remove curse spell, or consumes a goodberry. Regardless of how many curses have accumulated, fulfilling any of these conditions removes all hunger curses at once.

action.name: Devour
action.text: Gluttony can devour an unconscious or dead creature of Medium or smaller size. If the creature was alive it immediately dies. The gluttony gains resistance against all damage until the start of its next turn and 9 (1d10 + 4) temporary hit points.

monster.description:
Madwalker 1st Level
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 160 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Aspect of Envy

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The envy can breathe both air and water

trait.name: Magic Envy (Recharge 6)
trait.text: If a 1st or 2nd level spell is cast within the Envy's line of sight, it can immediately use its reaction to cast the same spell, without requiring any components, against a valid target of envy's choice.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The envy has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the envy's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The envy makes two attacks, either two bites or two Eye of Envy attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Eye of Envy
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) psychic damage, and until the start of the envy's next turn, whenever the target regains hit points, the envy regains the same amount.

monster.description:
Madwalker 3rd Level
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 160 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Aspect of Disgust

trait.name: Acid Skin
trait.text: A creature that touches the disgust or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) acid damage. Each hit on the disgust with a nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood induces corrosion. After dealing damage, the weapon suffers a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. The weapon is destroyed if the penalty reaches -5. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the disgust is destroyed after dealing damage.

trait.name: Stench
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the disgust must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a success, the creature becomes immune to the disgust's stench for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The disgust makes three Gastric Spit attacks.

action.name: Gastric Spit
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 2) acid damage.

action.name: Disgusting Vomit (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The disgust expels acid in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 (3d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. After this initial effect, all creatures within 20 feet of the disgust (whether they were in the cone or not) must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the end of their next turn due to the nauseating sight. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the disgust's Disgusting Vomit for 24 hours.

monster.description:
Madwalker 5th Level
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 161 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Aspect of Sloth

trait.name: Surge of Action (Recharge 5-6)
trait.text: As a bonus action, the sloth can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Aura of Laziness
trait.text: Creatures that start their turn within 15 feet of the sloth have their speed halved for that turn. If the creature ends its turn inside the aura, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or become restrained until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The sloth regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. The target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 3 (1d6) poison damage, can't take reactions until the end of its next turn, and has its speed halved until the end of the sloth's next turn. On a successful one, the target takes half as much damage and doesn't suffer the other effects.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monster.description:
Madwalker 7th Level
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 161 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Aspect of Pain

trait.name: Thorns
trait.text: The pain is covered in thorns. A creature that touches the pain or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet takes 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

trait.name: Suffering
trait.text: Damage dealt by the pain ignores temporary hit points and resistances. If pain reduces a creature to 0 hp while it has temporary hit points, it falls unconscious and is dying as normal.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The pain makes three attacks with its Painful Claws.

action.name: Painful Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on its next attack roll or ability check due to intense pain.

action.name: Excruciating Pain
action.text: The pain targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target creature must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target creature takes 13 (3d6 + 3) psychic damage, falls prone, and drops any held equipment.

action.name: Thorn Rain (recharge 5-6)
action.text: The pain launches a volley of thorns in a 20-foot radius around it. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) piercing damage and becoming impaled with thorns on a failed save, or half as much damage and no impalement on a successful one. A creature impaled with thorns takes an extra 7 (2d6) psychic damage each time it takes damage until it completes a long rest or is targeted by a lesser restoration spell or greater. A creature can only be affected by one thorn impalement at a time.

monster.description:
Madwalker 9th Level
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 162 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Aspect of Lust

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The lust can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Charm Opportunist
trait.text: Attacks made by lust that hit a charmed creature are automatically considered critical hits.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Lust makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Creepy Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained, and lust can't attack another target with a tentacle.

action.name: Mind Overload
action.text: The lust targets one charmed creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Charisma saving throw, taking 5d10 psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This attack doesn't end the charmed condition on a creature.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The lust casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks).
• At will: command • 3/Day each: charm person, hold person • 1/Day each: charm monster, dominate beast, hypnotic pattern

action.name: Fascinating Presence
action.text: Each creature of lust's choice that is within 60 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or become charmed for 1 minute or until lust or its allies harm the target. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.spells: Command, Charm Person, Hold Person, Charm Monster, Dominate Beast, Hypnotic Pattern
monster.description:
Madwalker 11th Level
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 162 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Aspect of Sadness

trait.name: Dispel Master
trait.text: The sadness can cast dispel magic as a bonus action and it is always considered as if it was cast using a 5th level spell slot.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The sadness has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Melancholy Magic
trait.text: When a creature fails a saving throw against a spell cast by the sadness, it has disadvantage on all saving throws until it finishes a short or long rest.

trait.name: Sad But True
trait.text: When the sadness dies, it explodes in a burst of psychic energy. Each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw, taking 13 (3d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sadness makes two Creepy Slam attacks.

action.name: Creepy Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Planar Shift (2/Day)
action.text: The sadness can cast plane shift (self only) twice per day to shift from the Material Plane to the Penumbral Plane, or vice versa.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The sadness casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks):
• At will: detect magic, dispel magic, fire bolt, shocking grasp • 3/Day each: faerie fire, identify, counterspell, detect thoughts, fireball, misty step • 1/Day each: banishment, cloud kill, globe of invulnerability, stoneskin, wall of force

monster.spells: Detect Magic, Dispel Magic, Fire Bolt, Shocking Grasp, Faerie Fire, Identify, Counterspell, Detect Thoughts, Fireball, Misty Step, Banishment, Cloud Kill, Globe of Invulnerability, Stoneskin, Wall of Force
monster.description:
Madwalker 13th Level
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 163 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Aspect of Pride

trait.name: Prideful Grappler
trait.text: The pride has advantage on attack rolls against creatures it is grappling.

trait.name: Armor of Pride
trait.text: Whenever an enemy attack misses the pride it gains a cumulative +1 to AC until the start of its next turn (up to +5).

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The pride makes three Claws or three Force Blast attacks. If the pride hits at least one attack with its Claws, it can make a Grab with its remaining attacks against the target hit.

action.name: Force Blast
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) force damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage.

action.name: Grab
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: the target is grappled (escape DC 17). Targets that are Huge or larger are immune.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The pride casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks):
• At will: detect magic, expeditious retreat, false life, feather fall • 3/Day each: enhance ability, invisibility, levitate, misty step • 2/Day each: counterspell, fly, haste, slow • 1/Day: blight

monster.spells: Detect Magic, Expeditious Retreat, False Life, Feather Fall, Enhance Ability, Invisibility, Levitate, Misty Step, Counterspell, Fly, Haste, Slow, Blight
monster.description:
Madwalker 15th Level
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 163 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Aspect of Greed

trait.name: Covetous Globes
trait.text: Greed watches over the material world from the Penumbral Plane via its magical Mask of Scrying. When they spy an appropriate target, usually some crusading do-gooder or powerful noble, they shift to the Material Plane and attack with their covetous globes. The globes cause enough damage to seem like a real threat, but this is a ruse. Their real power lies in the transmission of the Curse of Greed.

trait.name: Curse of Greed
trait.text: Every day at dusk, in which a victim of this terrible curse fails to accumulate at least 500 gp in gold, goods, or treasures, their maximum hit points are reduced by 2 (1d4) points. The curse cannot be lifted by a simple remove curse spell, but it does grant the recipient the knowledge of how to end the curse. To remove a Curse of Greed, the victim must permanently sacrifice at least 10,000 gold pieces in valuable items, such as useful magic items, family heirlooms of great sentimental value, or other treasures.

trait.name: Mask of Scrying
trait.text: Greed wears enchanted, bird like masks of bone covered in magical runes over their grotesque faces. The masks allow them to peer into the Material Plane at will, as if using the scrying spell, even if they are not currently on that plane. The mask crumbles to dust if removed from the emogun's person or if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The greed makes two attacks with its Claws and two with its Covetous Globes.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Draining Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) necrotic damage, and the greed regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

action.name: Covetous Globes
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) necrotic damage. Each creature struck by a globe must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 17) or be afflicted by the Curse of Greed.

action.name: Planar Shift
action.text: The greed can cast plane shift (self only) to enter the Material Plane, cause mischief or attack with its covetous globes, then return to the penumbra to savor its victim's fate.

monster.description:
Madwalker 17th Level
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 164 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Aspect of Fear

trait.name: Guided by Fear
trait.text: The fear has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are frightened.

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The fear can use its action to polymorph into a Small, Medium, or Large humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Terror Aura
trait.text: At the start of each of its turns, the fear gains 1d6 temporary hit points for each frightened creature within 30 feet of it.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The fear makes three Fear Stab or three Psychic Blast attacks.

action.name: Fear Stab
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Psychic Blast
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) psychic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The fear casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks):
• At will: darkness, detect magic, silent image • 3/Day each: fear, major image • 1/Day each: dream, phantasmal killer

action.name: Terror Wave (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The fear emits psychic energy in a 40-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, the creature also becomes frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. On a success, the creature becomes immune to the fear's Terror Wave for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Planar Shift
action.text: The fear magically shifts from the Material Plane to the Penumbral Plane, or vice versa.

monster.spells: Darkness, Detect Magic, Silent Image, Fear, Major Image, Dream, Phantasmal Killer
monster.description:
Madwalker 19th Level
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 165 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Arachne Serf

trait.name: Prowlers
trait.text: The creature has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The creature can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
trait.text: While in contact with a web, the creature knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
trait.text: The creature ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The arachne serf makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Web Spinning
action.text:
The creature can spin webs to create difficult terrain or to restrain creatures. It can create webs to cover a 20-foot square for every 10 minutes of work. The terrain becomes difficult, and all creatures that touch the web must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or become restrained. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (each 20-foot square section has AC 10, hp 15, vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage; if it takes fire damage, all linked web sections take the same damage on the following round and all creatures in the area take 1d6 fire damage).
Arachne Special Powers: All Arachne monsters have this feature, but the madwalker cannot use it.

monster.description:
Madwalker 2nd Level
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 166 (Homebrew)

action.name: Web (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 12 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

monster.name: Arachne Sorcerer

trait.text: The creature can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Walker
trait.text: The creature ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The arachne sorcerer makes three Poisonous Claw attacks.

action.name: Poisonous Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage. A creature hit must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The arachne sorcerer casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks):
• At will: charm person, mage hand, poison spray • 3/Day each: sleep, fear, invisibility, see invisibility • 1/Day each: dimensional door

action.name: Web (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 13 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 8; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

action.name: Web Spinning
action.text:
The creature can spin webs to create difficult terrain or to restrain creatures. It can create webs to cover a 20-foot square for every 10 minutes of work. The terrain becomes difficult, and all creatures that touch the web must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or become restrained. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (each 20-foot square section has AC 10, hp 15, vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage; if it takes fire damage, all linked web sections take the same damage on the following round and all creatures in the area take 1d6 fire damage).
Arachne Special Powers: All Arachne monsters have this feature, but the madwalker cannot use it.

monster.name: Arachne Noble

trait.name: Prowlers
trait.text: The creature has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The creature can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
trait.text: While in contact with a web, the creature knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
trait.text: The creature ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The arachne noble makes three Poisonous Claw attacks.

action.name: Poisonous Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage. A hit creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute.

action.name: Poison Jet
action.text: The arachne noble sprays magic poison gas in a 40-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) poison damage and being poisoned on a failed save, or half as much damage and not getting poisoned on a successful one. At the end of each of its turns, a poisoned target can make a Constitution saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The arachne noble casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks):

Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 171 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Nightmare Lurker

trait.name: Future Omen (1/Day)
trait.text: Due to its ability to see the future, the creature can better the odds of fate. As a free action, the creature can re-roll a single saving throw, skill check, or attack roll made by any creature, either an ally or an enemy.

trait.name: Sixth Sense
trait.text: The creature uses double its proficiency bonus for Wisdom (Perception) checks.

trait.name: Precognition
trait.text: The creature can see into the future and react to it, never being surprised.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The nightmare lurker makes two Force Blast attacks.

action.name: Force Blast
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) force damage.

reaction.name: Future Guard (3/Day)
reaction.text: Due to its foresight, the creature can better dodge attacks. Using its reaction, the creature can add 2 to its AC against an attack made against it, after seeing the result of the roll.

action.text: The nightmare lord can create a momentary 20-foot radius area of unstable psychic energy up to 90 feet away. The Maelstrom deals 49 (9d10) psychic damage and scrambles the senses of creatures within the area. They must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the damage is halved, and they are not affected by the sense-scrambling effect. On a failure, creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks for one minute.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Spellcasting. The nightmare lord casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks):
• At will: clairvoyance, command, comprehend languages, levitate • 3/Day each: counterspell, locate creature, suggestion • 1/Day each: animate objects, arcane eye, telekinesis

reaction.name: Future Guard (3/Day)
reaction.text: Due to its foresight, the creature can better dodge attacks. Using its reaction, the creature can add 2 to its AC against an attack made against it, after seeing the result of the roll.

Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 177 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Guardian Sprout

action.name: Branch Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage and the guardian sprout can cause the target to become grappled if its size is Medium or smaller (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the guardian sprout can't use its Branch Slam on other targets.

monster.description: Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 223 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Guardian Shrub

action.name: Branch Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage and the guardian shrub can cause the target to become grappled if its size is Large or smaller (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the guardian shrub can't use its Branch Slam on other targets.

action.name: Root Entanglement (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The guardian shrub takes root in the ground and causes them to sprout in a 20-foot radius around it. All creatures in the area must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be restrained by the entangling roots. A creature restrained by the guardian shrub can use its action to make a Strength saving throw. On a success, it frees itself. As long as there is a restrained creature, the guardian shrub has its speed reduced to 0, if it moves on its turn the restrained creature is released.

monster.description: Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 223 (Homebrew)

action.name: Branch Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage and the guardian bush can cause the target to become grappled if its size is Large or smaller (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the guardian bush can't use its Branch Slam on other targets.

trait.text: The guardian tree can innately cast the goodberry spell, three times per day, requiring no material components.

action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage and the guardian tree can cause the target to become grappled if its size is Huge or smaller (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the guardian tree can't use its Branch Slam on other targets.

action.name: Root Entanglement (Recharge 5-6)

All creatures in the area must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be restrained by the entangling roots. A creature restrained by the guardian tree can use its action to make a Strength saving throw. On a success, it frees itself. monster.name: Sloth Invocation

trait.name: Armor Class
trait.text: 12 + 1 for each 2 sorcerer levels

trait.name: Hit Points
trait.text: 5x sorcerer level

trait.name: Aura of Laziness (15 ft)
trait.text: Any creature that enters or starts its turn in the aura must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, its speed is halved for the next minute. An affected creature that leaves the aura can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sloth invocation makes a number of attacks equal to your proficiency bonus.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: sloth invocation STR modifier (4) + your proficiency bonus, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d10 + 4 + your proficiency bonus piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monster.description: Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 250 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Gluttony Invocation

trait.name: Armor Class
trait.text: 10 + 1 for each 2 sorcerer levels

trait.name: Hit Points
trait.text: 5x sorcerer level

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
trait.text: The gluttony invocation has advantage on melee attack rolls against creatures that don't have all hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The gluttony invocation makes a number of attacks equal to your proficiency bonus.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: sluttony invocation STR modifier (4) + your proficiency bonus, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d10 + 4 + your proficiency bonus piercing damage. The Gluttony Invocation gains half of damage in temporary hit points. If the target is a living creature it must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be cursed. A cursed creature has disadvantage on attack rolls until eating during a short or long rest, being targeted by a remove curse spell, or eating a berry created by a goodberry spell.

monster.description: Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 251 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Armor Class
trait.text: 10 + 1 for each 2 sorcerer levels

trait.name: Hit Points
trait.text: 5x sorcerer level

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The envy invocation has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of its allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The envy invocation makes a number of attacks equal to your proficiency bonus.

action.name: Resentment Blast
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: Envy Invocation DEX modifier (4) + your proficiency bonus, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 1d8 + 4 + your proficiency bonus psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monster.description: Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 251 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Tanarean Pegasus

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
The tanarean pegasus is a stunning creature, known for its striking beauty and natural grace. This breed of pegasus boasts an impressive wingspan of up to 20 feet, making it a highly coveted mount for those seeking swift transportation and superior strength. However, training and handling this creature can present unique challenges. The tanarean pegasus lacks the intelligence of its regular pegasus counterpart, making it skittish and difficult to gain trust and obedience from. These instincts of self-preservation and tendency to flee can make the training process longer and more complicated.
To train a tanarean pegasus successfully, a trainer must create a secure and comfortable environment, introduce it to other trained mounts to develop socialization skills, and establish trust through consistent, patient handling and training. Despite these challenges, the tanarean pegasus is a valuable asset in Tanares, with its beauty, strength, and speed making it a worthy mount for those willing to put in the effort to train it.
Cost to training and Flying Points: Base: 6 Flying Points Monthly Cost | Extra Flying Points 20 gp | +1d6 50 gp | +2d6 80 gp | +3d6 120 gp | +4d6
Flying Maneuvers:
Rescue (2 FP). You can save an ally from falling. Use your reaction to fly to an ally that is falling within your flying range and hold them in the air. Apply only if another flying mounted enemy caused the falling.
Dive (2 FP). Using your mount's flight superiority, you quickly get out of the way of danger. You can take a reaction when you succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against an effect from another flying mounted enemy that would cause you to take half damage, such as fireball, to take no damage from the effect.
Flight Tenacity (4 FP). You know the dangerous movements of mounted enemies that would make you fall from the griffon. Whenever you or your mount would begin to fall due to an effect caused by a flying-mounted enemy, you can use this maneuver as a reaction to prevent the fall, considering a failed saving throw or ability check, if any, as a success.
Aerial Sprint (2 FP). The pegasus' instinct takes over and it charges against the mounted creature. As a bonus action, the mount gains extra flying speed for the current turn. The increase equals twice its flying speed (after applying any modifiers), but the mount must move toward a target flying-mounted enemy.
Inspiring Flying (3 FP). All allies gain 2 Flying Points. The mount regains this use after finishing a short or long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 296 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Tanarean Griffon

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: Keen Sight: The griffon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The griffon makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Beak: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Claws: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

monster.description:
The tanarean griffon is a fearsome creature with the powerful body of a lion and the majestic wings and head of an eagle. With a more muscular body than a regular griffon, it is a formidable opponent in combat. Though the tanarean griffon lacks intelligence and magical abilities, it more than makes up for it with its ferocity and strength. This makes it a difficult creature to train and control, requiring a patient and skilled trainer to gain its trust and loyalty.
The tanarean griffon can be unpredictable and aggressive, with a tendency to assert dominance over weaker foes. To successfully train one, a trainer must establish their own dominance and earn the griffon's respect through consistent handling and training. Providing a secure and comfortable environment is crucial to developing the creature's trust and obedience. Despite its challenges, the tanarean griffon is a powerful and imposing creature that can serve as a mount or companion for those who are willing to put in the effort to train it.
Cost to training and Flying Points: Base: 6 Flying Points Monthly Cost | Extra Flying Points 25 gp | +1d6 60 gp | +2d6 90 gp | +3d6 130 gp | +4d6
Flying Maneuvers:
Flight Destabilization (3 FP). A powerfull bull rush that can unbalance flying mounted enemies. As an attack, you try to destabilize the target's flight. The target must make a Dexterity or Strength saving throw with DC = 8 + griffon's Strength modifier + proficiency bonus. If it fails, it plummets towards the ground.
Winged Resilience (3 FP). The griffon's agility can be very effective against flying mounted enemies. Spend Flying Points to reduce the damage inflicted by a flying mounted enemy's attack by 12 points.
Flight Tenacity (4 FP). You know the dangerous movements of mounted enemies that would make you fall from the griffon. Whenever you or your mount would begin to fall due to an effect caused by a flying-mounted enemy, you can use this maneuver as a reaction to prevent the fall, considering a failed saving throw or ability check, if any, as a success.
Aerial Sprint (2 FP). The griffon' instinct takes over and it charges against a target flying mounted enemy. As a bonus action, the mount gains extra flying speed for the current turn. The increase equals twice its flying speed (after applying any modifiers), but the mount must move toward a target flying-mounted enemy.
Fearsome Claws (3FP). Three enemies lose 2 Flying Points. The mount regains this use after finishing a short or long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 297 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Tanarean Hippogriff

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The hippogriff has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The hippogriff doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hippogriff makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

monster.description:
The tanarean hippogriff is a majestic creature with the body of a horse and the head and wings of an eagle. Like its regular hippogriff counterpart, it can grow up to 10 feet in length and possesses incredible speed and agility. However, the tanarean hippogriff lacks intelligence, making it challenging to train and control. It can be skittish and easily frightened, requiring a patient and skilled trainer to gain its trust and obedience.
To train a tanarean hippogriff successfully, a trainer must create a safe and comfortable environment and introduce the hippogriff to other trained mounts to develop socialization skills. The trainer must also establish trust through consistent handling and training. Despite its challenges, the tanarean hippogriff is a valuable and sought-after creature, prized for its speed, agility, and even beauty.
Cost to training and Flying Points: Base: 4 Flying Points Monthly cost | Extra Flying Points 15 gp +1d4 30 gp +2d4 50 gp +3d4 75 gp +4d4
Flying Maneuvers:
Flight Destabilization (3 FP). A powerfull bull rush that can unbalance flying mounted enemies. As an attack, you try to destabilize the target's flight. The target must make a Dexterity or Strength saving throw with DC = 8 + hippogriff 's Strength modifier + proficiency bonus. If it fails, it plummets towards the ground.
Rescue (2 FP). Observing the movement of the mounted enemy, you can save your ally from the falling. Use your reaction to fly to an ally that falls within your flying range and hold them in the air. Apply only it another mounted creature caused the falling.
Winged Resilience (3 FP). The griffon's claws can be very effective against flying mounted enemies. Spend Flying Points to reduce the damage inflicted by a flying mounted enemy's attack by 12 points.
Forced Landing (1 FP). When a flying mounted enemy makes your mount fall, you can use this maneuver to land safely on the ground without suffering any damage from falling. Your mount can take to the air again on your next turn.
Inner Strenght (3 FP). As a bonus action, you allow a creature to immediately use its reaction to make a maneuver using Flying Points, but with the cost reduced by 2. The mount regains this use after finising a short or long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 298 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Tanarean Desert Drake

trait.name: Assault
trait.text: If the desert drake moves at least 15 feet before it hits with a Bite attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 4 (1d8) additional piercing damage.

trait.name: Wild Accuracy
trait.text: For each other desert drake within 30 feet, this drake receives +1 on attack rolls (max +5).

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Necrotic Breath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The desert drake exhales necrotic energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must take a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description:
The drake is a formidable creature that strikes fear into the hearts of many adventurers. With its muscular body, sharp claws, and fiery breath, it is a formidable opponent in combat. The drake is a solitary beast that does not form bonds with others. This makes it difficult to train and control, as it will only obey those it is intimidated by. The drake is also intelligent and can be difficult to outsmart, requiring a trainer with considerable skill and experience. To gain dominance over a drake, a trainer must establish authority and maintain a constant level of intimidation. While firm vocalization and daunting body language are usually sufficient, drakes occasionally try to engage in fights to demonstrate physical superiority. Therefore, it will sometimes be necessary to resort to physical intimidation with them, but it must be administered carefully to avoid triggering a worse violent response. Once the drake has been subdued, it can be trained in a variety of techniques, such as hunting and aerial combat exercises.
Drakes are carnivorous creatures that feed on a variety of prey, such as mammals and other creatures of the sky. Their diet is essential to maintaining their physical strength and agility. Training a Drake is a dangerous and difficult task, but those who are able to successfully train one will have a loyal and powerful companion that will serve them well in any adventure.
Cost to training and Flying Points Base: 8 Flying Points Monthly cost | Extra Flying Points 50 gp | +1d8 120 gp | +2d8 250 gp | +3d8 500 gp | +4d8
Flying Maneuvers: Winged Resilience (3 FP). The drake's tough scales are highly effective against mounted enemies in the air. Spend Flying Points to reduce the damage inflicted by a flying mounted enemy's attack by 12 points.
Flight Destabilization (3 FP). A powerful bull rush that can unbalance even the most skilled flying mounted enemies.
As an attack, you to try to destabilize the target's flight. The target must make a Dexterity or Strength saving throw with DC = 8 + drake's Strength modifier + proficiency bonus. If it fails, it plummets towards the ground.
Flight Blindness (4 FP). This powerful maneuver weakens the connection between a flying mount and its rider. It generates a powerful wave that interferes with their flight, preventing the mounted enemy from using any Flying Points until the start of your next turn. The only way to avoid this effect is to spend 6 Flying Points.
Forced Landing (1 FP). When a flying mounted enemy makes your mount fall, you can use this maneuver to land safely on the ground without suffering any damage from falling. Your mount can take to the air again on your next turn.
Final Breath (5 FP). The Drake's fiery breath is a fearsome weapon against flying mounted enemies. When you use it, you can also utilize any of your Flying Maneuvers at no cost against one of the targets the breath is aimed at. The drake this use after finishing a short or long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 299 (Homebrew), Tanares Sourcebook p. 306 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Tanarean Jungle Drake

trait.name: Wild Strength
trait.text: For each other jungle drake within 30 feet, this drake receives +1 to damage rolls of its attacks (max +5).

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Acid Breath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The jungle drake exhales acid in a 45-foot line. Each creature in that line must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Final Breath (5 FP). The Drake's fiery breath is a fearsome weapon against flying mounted enemies. When you use it, you can also utilize any of your Flying Maneuvers at no cost against one of the targets the breath is aimed at. The drake this use after finishing a short or long rest.

monster.name: Tanarean Ridge Drake

trait.name: Wild Reflexes
trait.text: For each other ridge drake within 30 feet., this drake receives +1 to its AC (max +5).

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

action.name: Cold Breath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The ridge drake exhales an icy blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 27 (5d10) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description:
The drake is a formidable creature that strikes fear into the hearts of many adventurers. With its muscular body, sharp claws, and fiery breath, it is a formidable opponent in combat. The drake is a solitary beast that does not form bonds with others. This makes it difficult to train and control, as it will only obey those it is intimidated by. The drake is also intelligent and can be difficult to outsmart, requiring a trainer with considerable skill and experience. To gain dominance over a drake, a trainer must establish authority and maintain a constant level of intimidation. While firm vocalization and daunting body language are usually sufficient, drakes occasionally try to engage in fights to demonstrate physical superiority. Therefore, it will sometimes be necessary to resort to physical intimidation with them, but it must be administered carefully to avoid triggering a worse violent response. Once the drake has been subdued, it can be trained in a variety of techniques, such as hunting and aerial combat exercises.
Drakes are carnivorous creatures that feed on a variety of prey, such as mammals and other creatures of the sky. Their diet is essential to maintaining their physical strength and agility. Training a Drake is a dangerous and difficult task, but those who are able to successfully train one will have a loyal and powerful companion that will serve them well in any adventure.
Cost to training and Flying Points Base: 8 Flying Points Monthly cost | Extra Flying Points 50 gp | +1d8 120 gp | +2d8 250 gp | +3d8 500 gp | +4d8
Flying Maneuvers: Winged Resilience (3 FP). The drake's tough scales are highly effective against mounted enemies in the air. Spend Flying Points to reduce the damage inflicted by a flying mounted enemy's attack by 12 points.
Flight Destabilization (3 FP). A powerful bull rush that can unbalance even the most skilled flying mounted enemies.
As an attack, you to try to destabilize the target's flight. The target must make a Dexterity or Strength saving throw with DC = 8 + drake's Strength modifier + proficiency bonus. If it fails, it plummets towards the ground.
Flight Blindness (4 FP). This powerful maneuver weakens the connection between a flying mount and its rider. It generates a powerful wave that interferes with their flight, preventing the mounted enemy from using any Flying Points until the start of your next turn. The only way to avoid this effect is to spend 6 Flying Points.
Forced Landing (1 FP). When a flying mounted enemy makes your mount fall, you can use this maneuver to land safely on the ground without suffering any damage from falling. Your mount can take to the air again on your next turn.
Final Breath (5 FP). The Drake's fiery breath is a fearsome weapon against flying mounted enemies. When you use it, you can also utilize any of your Flying Maneuvers at no cost against one of the targets the breath is aimed at. The drake this use after finishing a short or long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 299 (Homebrew), Tanares Sourcebook p. 307 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Butler

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

monster.description:
The butler is the mainstay of your operation, responsible for maintaining the Headquarters with cleaning, organization, and caretaking services. Additionally, they provide support to the Adventure Team, acting as a receptionist for visitors and facilitating communication between the team and the rest of the Headquarters. By ensuring everything runs smoothly, the butler allows the Adventure Team to focus on their heroic pursuits.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 304 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Arcane Scholar

trait.name: Ritualistic
trait.text: When inside an Arcane Library of the Headquarters, the arcane scholar can cast 1st and 2nd level spells as rituals, provided that they have the ritual tag and the arcane scholar has a spellbook containing the spell.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Arcane scholar's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 11). The arcane scholar knows the following spells:
• Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation • 1st level (only ritual): detect magic, identify

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

monster.spells: Mage Hand, Prestidigitation, Detect Magic, Identify
monster.description:
The library is not just a collection of books and artifacts. It is also home to the arcane scholar, a dedicated staff member who compensates for their lack of combat ability with their vast knowledge of magic. Assigned to the Arcane Library, the arcane scholar is able to identify magic items, obtain components, and perform rituals, thus enhancing the library's capabilities and the Adventure Team's magical knowledge.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 305 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Breeder

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The breeder's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 11). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• 1/Day: animal friendship

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 +1) piercing damage.

action.name: Whip
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

monster.spells: Mage Hand, Prestidigitation, Detect Magic, Identify
monster.description:
With the aid of a skilled breeder, the stable staff, the Stables can not only provide care and training for the mounts but also produce offspring that can be sold for significant amounts of gold. The breeder possesses great empathy when dealing with animals and can even tame ever more powerful creatures as they gain experience.
To utilize the services of the breeder, the Stable structure is required. Whether it's a quick rest or a longer stay, the Stable is the perfect place to keep your mounts safe and well taken care of while adventuring in the dangerous lands of Tanares.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 306 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Craftsman

trait.name: Profession (Crafter)
trait.text: The craftsman adds their proficiency bonus (+2) when using a tool (not supplies, kits or utensils) from the artisan's tools.

action.name: Light hammer
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
The craftsman is a skilled artisan who dedicates their callused hands and sweat-stained clothing to producing high-quality items and equipment from diverse materials. Their passion for their craft is only matched by their expertise, and they thrive in the Workshop's creative environment. They not only produce masterpieces but also generate value for the Adventure Team by selling their creations, making the Workshop an indispensable resource.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 307 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Tavern Keeper

trait.name: Profession (Chef)
trait.text: The tavern keeper adds their proficiency (+2) when using brewer's supplies or cook's utensils.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
The tavern keeper is the staff member in charge of the Tavern's operation, from serving customers to managing inventory and finances. With their expertise, they know how to handle unruly patrons and entice new customers with alluring deals. As the tavern's profits grow, the tavern keeper's skills develop, and they can increase the establishment's earnings and make it a truly profitable venture for the Adventure Team.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 308 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Doctor

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The doctor's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 11). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• at will: light, spare the dying

trait.name: Treatment (1/Day)
trait.text: Creatures that take a short rest under the care of the doctor recover the maximum amount of hit points from the Hit Dice they spend during the rest. The doctor can treat up to 4 creatures at the same time with this ability.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage

action.name: First Aid (10/Day)
action.text: The doctor performs first aid on a humanoid creature that is not dead and has 0 hit points, restoring 1 hit point to it.

monster.spells: Light, Spare the Dying
monster.description:
The doctor is a skilled healer who oversees the Healing Hall and tends to the injured and sick members of the team. Their expertise in medicine and healing magic is invaluable in restoring hit points to the PCs, ensuring they are ready for their next adventure. With each upgrade to the Healing Hall, the doctor gains access to more advanced medical tools and supplies, allowing them to better care for those in need.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 309 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Wayfinder

trait.name: Profession (Mapper)
trait.text: The wayfinder adds their proficiency (+2) when using calligrapher's supplies, cartographer's tools, or navigator's tools.

trait.name: Log Mind
trait.text: The wayfinder always knows the direction of north and the time of day

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands.

monster.description:
The wayfinder is a learned scholar who possesses knowledge of celestial bodies, space, and the land and its terrain, aiding the Adventure Team in their journeys. With expertise in astronomy and cartography, the wayfinder creates precise maps of the land and cosmos, predicts the alignment of stars, and performs magical feats to help the group navigate. As they continue to hone their skills, the wayfinder becomes an invaluable member of the Adventure Team, unlocking the secrets of the world around them.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 310 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Head Guard

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: The head guard has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

monster.description:
The head guard is the master of military defense for the Headquarters. With their vast knowledge of combat strategies, both in open fields and siege tactics, they ensure an unrivaled shield for the fortress. Their experience in training and leading soldiers is crucial for the recruitment and management of a strong defense force, ready to repel any threat to the Headquarters.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 311 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Farmer

trait.name: Natural Vitality
trait.text: The farmer has advantage on saving throws against exhaustion.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
The farmer is a seasoned expert in the art of cultivation and livestock management. With a keen sense of the land and its natural rhythms, they bring forth bountiful harvests and raise healthy livestock. Their expertise in managing the Farm ensures that the crops and animals continue to flourish and produce, providing an abundance of food and resources to support the community and the Adventure Team.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 312 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Curator

trait.name: Connoisseur
trait.text: The curator has advantage on any ability check to determine whether an archaeological or art piece is legitimate or imitation.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

monster.description:
Behind thick glasses and with one or two thick books always at their waist, the curator is the guardian of the Museum's vast collection. Responsible for guiding visitors through the halls and showcasing the Adventure Team's latest discoveries, they are also charged with studying ancient tomes to aid the group in their quest for precious artifacts. With an unwavering dedication to the protection of the Museum's treasures, the curator ensures that the Headquarters remains a place of knowledge for all adventurers.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 313 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Harbor Master

trait.name: Coast-born
trait.text: The harbor master has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks related to swimming.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

monster.description:
With a clipboard in hand, the harbor master oversees all arrivals and departures from the endless sea, ensuring a smooth operation of the Pier. Their management skills allow the Adventure Team to control larger vessels and increase their profits over time. The harbor master also spreads the word about the team's accomplishments to the taverns of the harbor district, earning them a reputation as successful traders and explorers.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 314 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Herbalist
monster.languages: Common, Sylvan, plus any one language

trait.name: Profession (Herbalist)
trait.text: The herbalist adds their proficiency bonus (+2) when using a herbalism kit.

trait.name: Speak with Plants
trait.text: The herbalist can communicate with plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
The herbalist is a skilled cultivator and alchemist, able to nurture and extract the purest potion or the most nefarious poison from the natural treasures of various regions. Their ability to cultivate and care for the plants in the Garden ensures that each vial is filled with a much stronger compound than usual, at a lower cost than standard. With an advanced herbalist, the Garden can produce rare and potent ingredients that can be used to create powerful magic items.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 315 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Heroic Staff

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: The heroic staff has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Determination
trait.text: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the heroic staff hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Training
trait.text: The Heroic Staff retains all previous abilities and proficiencies it had.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The heroic staff makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage. Versatility: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage

action.name: Shield Bash
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reaction.name: Block
reaction.text: The heroic staff gains a +3 bonus to Dexterity saving throws imposed by spells or area effects. To do so, the heroic staff must see the attacker or origin of effect and must be wielding a shield.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The heroic staff adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the heroic staff must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.description: Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 317 (Homebrew)
